recommendations: Excellent! You're dominating the Local Pack. Focus on maintaining your #1 positions with consistent review generation and GMB updates.

reviews.text:
I had the sliced brisket on a Wednesday morning, and I must say it was fantastic. It was moist tender, and the texture was perfection. Everything about it was totally on point. In Los Angeles it‚Äôs hard to find good quality barbecue and I must say I was so impressed with what I had at Baby blues. I‚Äôve been coming here for years and sometimes it‚Äôs anywhere from good to great not always great but the brisket I must say was absolutely as good as you can get and I grew up in Texas.

I‚Äôll also say that the price point wasn‚Äôt terrible while it‚Äôs not as reasonable as I wanted to be it‚Äôs still in terms of Los Angeles prices it‚Äôs fair I suppose in his new era of higher prices lol

Baby Blues is simply amazing! All in-house smoked and barbecued bbq, homemade sides, local and family owned, fair prices, clean dining room and bathrooms‚Ä¶ And the food is just delicious to the max! The bacon blue burger is my favorite burger in town! Even the iced tea, both unsweet and sweet is brewed fresh and absolutely perfect. Fresh lemons to squeeze too, I‚Äôm just in love with the place! Thanks so much you guys! I‚Äôll see you again soon!

I stumbled upon this place as I was looking to go to another restaurant that‚Äôs was closed for in dining service. Best thing that ever happened to me. Normally, it is hard to find a good bbq place but boy was I surprised by this place. The service was great. 3 different people approached me to take my order before I decided on what to get. I chose to e 1/2 pound chicken, Mac and cheese, collard greens, potato salad and beans along with some tropical punch Kool-Aid. Where can you get that these days? Ty r food was very well seasoned and the chicken had a great smoke taste to it. The best was by far the collard greens. They tasted like my grandmother was in the kitchen making them. This place didn‚Äôt disappoint at all. I will definitely be going back there. If you want some good food along with a cozy atmosphere, this is definitely the place for you.

First time here after many years of driving past this place. Was hesitant due to a 4.4 rating, but gave it a go. Food is about a 3.5-3.7, as I ordered Memphis ribs which were not tender and quite dry. I let the waitress know, but I decided to just eat what was on the plate not to waste that food. Collard greens were good, nothing stood out, stewed with tomatoes, Mac n cheese seemed bland to some degree. As others mentioned, the cornbread is the standout item. My waitress was exceptional and the vibe is cool. Not sure if I‚Äôd go back for ribs. Price is about on par with other bbq spots, $29 for the plate. Think my Dr Pepper was $4.50? That‚Äôs insane. The key lime pie was good $7.

I ordered through Uber eats. The delivery was quick,  food arrived hot. All seemed to be going well, then I tried eating the food. Let me say, I was a huge Baby Blues fan from back in the day but this was the absolute worst BBQ  I ever had in my life,  hands down.  The catfish was blah,  pulled pork dry, brisket was actually closer to jerky than to brisket, and the ribs were tasteless.  I have no axe to grind, no vendetta, but when I spend $100 for 1 person,  it better be good. I looked at there hours and they do close at 9pm...I ordered probably close to 8:45pm, but that shouldn't have any bearing on my order and if it is going to effect the quality,  don't take the order. Sending this garbage out was a terrible decision.  So disappointing.

editorial_summary.overview: Unpretentious, down-home barbecue spot known for its pulled pork & babyback ribs.

detailedReviews.author: Mara Thompson
detailedReviews.text: Chicken wings a consistent favorite. Service friendly, place is clean and that bbq has it always smelling delicious. One minus, last time I picked some up the cole slaw had a grey cast, no green?!?

detailedReviews.author: Megan Keyser
detailedReviews.text: literally so yum!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Goldfarb
detailedReviews.text: This is hands down the best bbq place in LA  awesome ribs, chicken and sides and tge sauces are delicious.  Run, dont walk to get some asap

detailedReviews.author: Kate Pletcher
detailedReviews.text: Such a great spot!  We‚Äôre lucky to be in the neighborhood,  it even if I weren‚Äôt, I‚Äôd travel here. The best lunch special on the Westside. Quick and tasty. You can be in and out of there in half an hour. Love meeting folks there for happy hour, too!

detailedReviews.author: Jay Payne
detailedReviews.text: Don‚Äôt ever eat at this place. This is definitely not barbecue very terrible old meat picture of that shit.

detailedReviews.author: Eliza Bennett
detailedReviews.text: Wow!!! Amazing barbecue, best we have found in LA for sure. My favorites were the Hawaiian sliders and the hush puppies üòçüòç. All of the meat was perfectly cooked, and their barbecue sauce is unbelievable. our servers Hernan and Andrea were both so kind, attentive, and helpful! We will absolutely be back.

detailedReviews.author: Nicholas Stigall
detailedReviews.text: Great food!!!

detailedReviews.author: Jessica S.
detailedReviews.text: Everything was spot on‚Äî atmosphere, service, and most of all the food. We got a family style assortment of meats, and everything was fall off the bone tender. The brisket was my absolute favorite and the house made BBQ sauce was incredible! Also don‚Äôt miss the Mac and cheese or Banana pudding.

detailedReviews.author: John Joseph Minardi
detailedReviews.text: It pains me to write this, but my meal the other day was horrible but expensive. Not been back since they reopened after the fire and was looking forward to it because it was always my go to place. I was so disappointed. My Baby Back ribs were dry and tough. I ate maybe a 1/4 of it before giving up. Oh well.

detailedReviews.author: T H
detailedReviews.text: The food is the best and the owners are so nice and friendly. They went out of their way to see that our meals were exactly what we hoped for. Love this place I just wish they‚Äôd have live music and it would be perfect then.

detailedReviews.author: Deanna Cook
detailedReviews.text: This restaurant has great vegan options and a very friendly staff. I recommend the burnt end, vegan corn muffin, and stewed tomatoes :)

detailedReviews.author: Cody Alexander (codyexplores)
detailedReviews.text:
I had the sliced brisket on a Wednesday morning, and I must say it was fantastic. It was moist tender, and the texture was perfection. Everything about it was totally on point. In Los Angeles it‚Äôs hard to find good quality barbecue and I must say I was so impressed with what I had at Baby blues. I‚Äôve been coming here for years and sometimes it‚Äôs anywhere from good to great not always great but the brisket I must say was absolutely as good as you can get and I grew up in Texas.

I‚Äôll also say that the price point wasn‚Äôt terrible while it‚Äôs not as reasonable as I wanted to be it‚Äôs still in terms of Los Angeles prices it‚Äôs fair I suppose in his new era of higher prices lol

detailedReviews.author: Sandra B
detailedReviews.text: Simply delicious and very tender

detailedReviews.author: Jackie Davenport
detailedReviews.text: We have been loyal followers of this place for years from the Fairfax & Santa Monica to the Sunset locations & we were overjoyed when Venice opened back up.  The food is always delicious and the sauces‚Ä¶.. The xxx really is xxx.  Thanks Baby Blues for always being delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Joy Belinda Beland
detailedReviews.text: We ordered a selection of chicken wings through Baby Blues catering and they were the biggest hit of our party. Each of the BBQ, Sweet and Spicy, and Extra Hot disappeared quickly. It was easy to place the order and arrange pickup and well worth the money!  Baby Blues will be our go-to for parties moving forward.

detailedReviews.author: David Pfuhler
detailedReviews.text: Simply amazing. What a lovely waitress. Keep going like that.

detailedReviews.author: Martha Villegas
detailedReviews.text: I had the gaint beef rib, very tender flavorful delicious ... the butter spich , the corn bread. I will return  highly recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Ellen Eisen
detailedReviews.text: Great ribs and the best cole slaw and potato salad ever. Lunch special is a great value.

detailedReviews.author: Colin Wolfe
detailedReviews.text: They are always professional and friendly there , love that food and staff

detailedReviews.author: Brandyn Marquardt
detailedReviews.text: Too difficult to order delivery so we gave up.

detailedReviews.author: Janelle N
detailedReviews.text: Cute place, nothing uber fancy but the food is really really good! They have lunch specials that are very reasonably priced. Good customer service. The Mac n cheese, potato salad, corn bread, tri tip and brisket are bomb. Support places like this, we need to keep them.

detailedReviews.author: Kimberly Gamez
detailedReviews.text: This place is a hidden gem! The buffalo wings well done and the banana cream pudding stood out but really, everything was delicious. Andrea is an excellent server - she was on top of everything and so friendly.

detailedReviews.author: LuckonLuck
detailedReviews.text: Baby Blues is simply amazing! All in-house smoked and barbecued bbq, homemade sides, local and family owned, fair prices, clean dining room and bathrooms‚Ä¶ And the food is just delicious to the max! The bacon blue burger is my favorite burger in town! Even the iced tea, both unsweet and sweet is brewed fresh and absolutely perfect. Fresh lemons to squeeze too, I‚Äôm just in love with the place! Thanks so much you guys! I‚Äôll see you again soon!

detailedReviews.author: Juan
detailedReviews.text: I love baby blues

detailedReviews.author: Juddy Jacobs
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely horrendous. As a Texan this isn‚Äôt even BBQ. I went in and ordered ribs and they were grilling it on a stovetop oven .. absolutely no Smokey flavor, just bbq sauce . Completely unauthentic sorry excuse for bbq.

detailedReviews.author: florent belleau
detailedReviews.text:
Super restau si vous √™tes de passage √† LA.
L‚Äôambiance est top, l‚Äô√©quipe aussi, et les plats qu‚Äôon a pris √©taient super bons.

detailedReviews.author: Eddie Utah
detailedReviews.text: This place is a gem! Lunch specials are where it‚Äôs at because they‚Äôre a steal for such high quality. The sauces and cornbread are some of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Highly recommend the pulled pork and Memphis ribs. Key lime pie is also a win. It‚Äôs a bit of a trek to get across Lincoln but it‚Äôs completely worth it.

detailedReviews.author: Hanh Le
detailedReviews.text: Our family came here for a late lunch and was greeted by one of the owners.  The ribs are delicious!  Portions were large.  We really enjoyed eating here.

detailedReviews.author: phyllis phillips
detailedReviews.text: My daughter and I went today for the 1st time.  Great food, great service and atmosphere. We had fried okra and hot wings for  appetizers. I had the Big Blue platter (choice of 3 meats, 2 sides, and cornbread. Ample portions, we had to pack up our leftovers! Definitely will return again!

detailedReviews.author: Krystal Lowry
detailedReviews.text: The brisket is the only thing I ordered and it was fantastic! Absolutely  delicious! The staff was all very friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend and would love to eat here again if I'm in the area.

detailedReviews.author: Elias de Vries
detailedReviews.text: The employes we're very nice the Food tasted amazing and the price was pretty fair

detailedReviews.author: Neil B
detailedReviews.text:
Can‚Äôt type, meat sweats want couch‚Ä¶then I‚Äôm going back for their sweets.

Bravo on your BBQ!

detailedReviews.author: Robin Armantrout
detailedReviews.text: Best bar b que in the south. We go every weekend.  Best mac n cheese ever. Our server Mandy is the best. She's know what we like and is in top of it with our drinks. She's always in great spirits and a pleasure to see.

detailedReviews.author: Matt Motal
detailedReviews.text:
An absolute staple for BBQ on the west side!

I've been going to Baby Blues for 20 years at this point, dating back to working in Venice. Just went today and it's as good as I remember. The BBQ is incredible! Brisket, pulled pork, ribs, smoked links, wings, cornbread, sweet potato mash, baked beans, coleslaw, banana cream pudding... it's all incredible! Prices are reasonable considering meat prices and you get a lot of food.

The people are all so cool, especially Andrea. She's been our server forever and she's the best! The atmosphere is relaxed and the place has a cool decor.

Baby Blues will always be my BBQ spot!

detailedReviews.author: Raquel Vallejo
detailedReviews.text: First time dining in the reopened restaurant - great new look, same delicious food!

detailedReviews.author: E M
detailedReviews.text: Came here for my father‚Äôs birthday. They were able to accommodate our party of 6 right away. The service was great and the food was even better! So glad they are open again. We will definitely be coming back here in the future!

detailedReviews.author: michael mason
detailedReviews.text: Too noisy for me with the background music

detailedReviews.author: david adams
detailedReviews.text: Okay ive had way better for the price a bit dry and under seasoned

detailedReviews.author: Lexy H. White
detailedReviews.text: The vibes are electric, the service is through the roof incredible, and the food was life changing. Can‚Äôt recommend enough

detailedReviews.author: Bret Weber
detailedReviews.text: I've been here many, many times, and it never disappoints! Everything on the menu it mouthwatering deliciousness üòã. Their XXX sauce is the best! Brisket,  pulled pork, hot links you name it, I've tried it.

detailedReviews.author: Frank Torres Jr
detailedReviews.text: Friendly staff needs more knowledge of company history. The dining room needs more character food, was awesome. Parking is tight.

detailedReviews.author: Philipp Tereshenko
detailedReviews.text: Let‚Äôs start with the meat - expect meat sweats! The baby back ribs were a home run, fall off the bone & had a great tangy char. BBQ sauce paired well with the lean brisket (nice peppercorn crust) and pulled pork. Variety of side dishes, Mac & Mash were decent. Cornbread was moist and fluffy.

detailedReviews.author: Mico Olmos
detailedReviews.text: One of the best burgers on the westside! Really Tasty!!

detailedReviews.author: Sonja Peterson
detailedReviews.text: We love Baby Blues BBQ. The food is great. I also love the rewards program. Sometimes we eat in the restaurant. Sometimes we do takeout. It‚Äôs always good!

detailedReviews.author: John Turner
detailedReviews.text: I stumbled upon this place as I was looking to go to another restaurant that‚Äôs was closed for in dining service. Best thing that ever happened to me. Normally, it is hard to find a good bbq place but boy was I surprised by this place. The service was great. 3 different people approached me to take my order before I decided on what to get. I chose to e 1/2 pound chicken, Mac and cheese, collard greens, potato salad and beans along with some tropical punch Kool-Aid. Where can you get that these days? Ty r food was very well seasoned and the chicken had a great smoke taste to it. The best was by far the collard greens. They tasted like my grandmother was in the kitchen making them. This place didn‚Äôt disappoint at all. I will definitely be going back there. If you want some good food along with a cozy atmosphere, this is definitely the place for you.

detailedReviews.author: Larry Farnsworth
detailedReviews.text: Great BBQ, reasonable prices, great vibe.

detailedReviews.author: Laura Ford
detailedReviews.text: We usually get our food "to go" - it is the best BBQ in LA. Great ribs, and pulled pork, wonderful chicken. Love their regular and their sweet BBQ sauces. Large portions and delicious. Great value.

detailedReviews.author: Jason Harley
detailedReviews.text: This is the best BBQ on the Westside. Food is great and prices are reasonable. Several different types of meats and sauces. Service is fantastic, staff is friendly, and the owners are nice. We have been going here for years. You definitely have to try this place; you won't be disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: Von L
detailedReviews.text: Always 5+üíØüíØ

detailedReviews.author: Aleksandar Micic
detailedReviews.text: Great food and beer selection!

detailedReviews.author: Jay Dillon
detailedReviews.text: Love me some Baby Blues BBQ with a nice chilly brew to wash er down with

detailedReviews.author: Jen Santos
detailedReviews.text: I had the sweet and spicy BBQ sauce and it was so spicy I could barely eat my sandwich. I mean Sweet and Spicy I wouldn't expect to be like atomic level. I was expecting a nice kick but not to have to down a glass a milk after every bite.

detailedReviews.author: J. SMc
detailedReviews.text: Good smoked barbecue on the west side. It's not fancy it's ol' school.

detailedReviews.author: Angee B
detailedReviews.text: Walked in 15 min before closing for a last minute new yrs eve dinner‚Ä¶gd customer service evn tho it was closing time‚Ä¶no one showed frustration over last minute customers‚Ä¶food was gd‚Ä¶seasoned gd and sides were fresh‚Ä¶i ordered the tri tip and it was very tasty nd ddnt evn need bbq sauce‚Ä¶def will go back here again‚Ä¶

detailedReviews.author: Mouni Reddy
detailedReviews.text: Best BBQ in West Los Angeles. Don't miss out on the banana pudding and the Mac N Cheese.

detailedReviews.author: Lois Thrower
detailedReviews.text: The first time I ordered the pound of brisket for my potluck I got maybe 6 thinly sliced delicious brisket, so I decided to order the same for my family. Except this time I received 4 very thick and stumpy cuts of brisket. It was not the same. I thought consistency was the name of the game. Heavy barked big chunks of brisket is not what I paid for. Booooo!!! üëé

detailedReviews.author: Whiskey Juliet
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in recently for dinner and had a good experience. The service was absolutely fantastic, super attentive, friendly and returning often to check on us. Food was on point - large portions & good flavor. Only complaint there was it could have been a bit warmer, but not a huge deal. The hush puppies and cornbread were phenomenal, tons of corn flavor and texture and the honey butter was a great addition. There was a nice variety of very tasty bbq sauces right at the table so you can make your taste experience your own. The music was a bit loud to have conversation but also not a deal breaker. We‚Äôd absolutely return again!

detailedReviews.author: Trip's Windows
detailedReviews.text: Some of the best bbq I‚Äôve had in LA.

detailedReviews.author: David Kagel
detailedReviews.text: WE took out on Saturday night and the food was incredible.  The white meat chicken had an incredible flavor and texture.    The baby back ribs fell off the bone and were sauced perfectly.    The pulled pork was also a treat .    The Memphis style flavoring is unique and very tasty.     The Mac and cheese to die for and the creamed spinach were great sides.  Their corn bread not to be missed and they even through in a wonderful lemon pie for a special treat.  Can't wait to go back!

detailedReviews.author: ÍπÄÎ≤î
detailedReviews.text: It was my first visit to the US, and the staff was so kind and the food was delicious. Thank you!

detailedReviews.author: Tactical Entity
detailedReviews.text:
As soon as I rolled into Baby Blue's Barbecue, the mouthwatering aroma wrapped around me like a cozy blanket, promising a feast fit for a king‚Äîand boy, did it deliver! I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, and when it arrived, my eyes widened in sheer delight. The bun was soft yet sturdy, cradling a generous heap of succulent, slow-smoked pulled pork that was so tender it practically melted in my mouth. Each bite was a glorious explosion of flavor, seasoned to perfection with a secret blend of spices that danced on my taste buds like a joyous jig. But let me tell you about those collard greens! Oh, sweet mercy! Cooked low and slow with just the right amount of smokiness and a hint of vinegar, they were so tender they nearly caved in to my eager fork. I savored every forkful, letting the rich, savory goodness linger as I gleefully plowed through my meal, feeling like a happy bear in a honey pot. I waddled out of there, my heart full and my stomach gloriously satisfied, already dreaming of my next indulgent visit to this BBQ paradise. Baby Blue‚Äôs is an absolute must for anyone like me who loves to embrace life one delicious bite at a time! As a disabled man (550-ish lbs) this restaurant was extremely accessible from a pragmatic stance. Highly recommend for all my plus-sized friends!

Lukewarm Regards - Humphry

detailedReviews.author: Niall Shapero
detailedReviews.text:
I had the baby back ribs with pork & beans and potato salad, my wife had the Memphis style ribs, stewed tomatoes, potato salad and cornbread. It was my first visit since they resumed business after their fire and shutdown. The cornbread and the ribs were every bit as good as I remember from the pre-fire period.

I managed to eat half my half rack, the corn bread, and perhaps a quarter of the pork & beans and one spoon full of potato salad. The reason? The portions are huge. I have NEVER been able to eat the ribs, two sides and cornbread in a single sitting.

The prices have gone up a bit from the pre-fire menu, but so has food in general. It's not cheap, but it is still VERY much worth it. I'll get at least two full meals and a snack out of it (my wife will likely get three full meals out of her order).

The ONLY regret I have is that the Texas beef rib is no longer on the menu (it was my wife's favorite). If they make ANY change to their menu, I would ask that they consider adding the Texas beef rib back on to the menu.

Be prepared for a HUGE pile of food, all of it delicious. Go, dine-in or take-out, you'll be very happy with the result -- though you may be stuffed to the gills when you're finished.

detailedReviews.author: alec wing
detailedReviews.text: Catfish is really good. Always order a mix of meats and sides and they never disappoint

detailedReviews.author: Devin Ashburn
detailedReviews.text: Just bought so much take-out and all of it is bland. No flavor. XXX wings aren‚Äôt spicy, cornbread smells like a gym shoe. Ribs are gross. Tossing it all.

detailedReviews.author: Martin De La Garcia jr
detailedReviews.text: For right now, it's the best barbecue I've ever had. So, Guy Fieri was correct, loved. The place been back twice from Santa Barbara. Amazing, make the trip, and you will be thanked by your taste, buds.

detailedReviews.author: Kris Krieger
detailedReviews.text: So glad they are open again! Amazing food, staff was fun and attentive! Family enjoyed our dinner immensely!

detailedReviews.author: Lastat
detailedReviews.text: Loved it

detailedReviews.author: David Earl Woodbury
detailedReviews.text:
Great location.
Easy parking
Cool vibe
Excellent food and menu
Thoughtful service
Wonderful banana pudding
Can't wait to return!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the perfectly cooked meats and incredible house-made BBQ sauce, making it a standout choice for BBQ enthusiasts. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The friendly and attentive service provided by staff like Hernan and Andrea leaves a lasting impression on diners. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The restaurant offers quick and tasty lunch specials, ideal for those looking for a fast yet delicious dining experience. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews about food quality and inconsistency (e.g., dry ribs, unauthentic BBQ, bland food) - review management can address this concern
Perception of unauthentic BBQ and lack of smokey flavor - social media marketing can improve this area
Difficulty in ordering delivery - Boostly marketing services can improve this
